text: Human cytomegalovirus binding to human monocytes induces immunoregulatory gene expression .

To continue our investigation of the cellular events that occur following human CMV ( HCMV ) infection , we focused on the regulation of cellular activation following viral binding to human monocytes .

First , we showed that viral binding induced a number of immunoregulatory genes ( <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> A20 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , NF-kappaB - <extra_id_0> p105 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in unactivated monocytes and that neutralizing Abs to the major HCMV glycoproteins , gB ( UL55 ) and gH ( UL75 ) , inhibited the induction of these genes .

text: Next , we demonstrated that these viral ligands directly up-regulated monocyte gene expression upon their binding to their appropriate cellular receptors .
We then investigated if HCMV binding also resulted in the translation and secretion of cytokines .
Our results showed that HCMV binding to monocytes resulted in the production and release of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein .

text: Because these induced gene products have NF-kappaB sites in their promoter regions , we next examined whether there was an up-regulation of nuclear NF-kappaB levels .
These experiments showed that , in fact , NF-kappaB was translocated to the nucleus following viral binding or purified viral ligand binding .
Changes in <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels correlated with the changes in NF-kappaB translocation .

Lastly , we demonstrated that p38 kinase activity played a central role in <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production and that it was rapidly up-regulated following infection .

text: These results support our hypothesis that HCMV initiates a signal transduction pathway that leads to monocyte activation and pinpoints a potential mechanism whereby HCMV infection of monocytes can result in profound pathogenesis , especially in chronic inflammatory-type conditions .
